intro: Adenorachis nigra, commonly known as black root, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in wetlands and along stream banks. The plant has a distinctive appearance with dark, almost black, tuberous roots that are often harvested for medicinal purposes. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided leaflets, and it produces small, white or greenish flowers in umbels. The botanical characteristics of Adenorachis nigra make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
